comments.author: sujonali1819
comments.body: @Isabel.DiceX Since the project is still in under development phase I would like to suggest you not keep the system like people can not review the site without registration. This is not user-friendly. And I assume people will avoid the site only for this.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: I do not like these sites that you cannot browse until you register on the site. Visitors must be given an opportunity to browse the site completely before logging in.Also, the rules on the registration page do not give clear information about the site’s policy. All that is present is general advice about the risks of gambling and a disclaimer of any risk assumed by users.The advice is good, of course, but it is not the site's policy. The site's policy must be written in detail so that all users can see it before registering and not after registering on the site.

comments.author: panjul07
comments.body: Quote from: aliveNFT on December 12, 2023, 06:59:36 PMSerious now, this thing is annyoing... why i can't travel around website and check that Provably fair actually included ? How do i check ToS, privacy terms e.t.c before i got registred. So strange. Will update information here.Unfortunately you will not find ToS, Privacy terms, or FAQ even if you have an account here. Just created a throw away account here because I'm a bit curious, that's why I can say you will not find ToS or other terms. Below is the only rules they have: They have Randomizer page but it looks so simple, unlike what I used to see in other reputable casinos. I'm surprised to see someone has wagered more than 7btc, 500k doge, 240k trx, and some other coins in this brand new dice site. Who is in this world who want to take a risk that much money in a new dice like this?

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: This is all wrong you should have an option to review the site before you register and not be forced to register before you can view, check, and review the platform, I thought I was having a hard time finding the close button on the pop registration, until I read other members' experience, and there's allegation this early, this is such a bad start for a casino.If they will not take down that popup registration and they will not resolve the accusation better forget this platform, we have a lot of better and highly reputable gambling platforms in this forum.  It's hard to take a risk on this one, the admin seems arrogant not to grant our request.

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: - No, terms & condition change to rules (It's really not suitable + don't understand)- Cannot access anything before register- Website seems like back to 2010- @OP Response on thread, weird like not in the topicI think people should agree, these kind of activity already make some a few red flags people are should avoid or not playing on the casino. Cause, seem like just not right by basic due diligency check.

comments.author: iv4n
comments.body: Quote from: ryzaadit on December 13, 2023, 06:18:28 PM- No, terms & condition change to rules (It's really not suitable + don't understand)- Cannot access anything before register- Website seems like back to 2010- @OP Response on thread, weird like not in the topicI think people should agree, these kind of activity already make some a few red flags people are should avoid or not playing on the casino. Cause, seem like just not right by basic due diligency check.I think the same about this casino and I agree with you that these points raised some red flags... and when there are red flags, I mean if there's even one red flag, people should be extra careful. By that I mean we should avoid making deposits, but if someone decides to check the casino despite all the red flags, he should make some small deposit. Well, Isabel needs a different approach... she needs to be more cooperative, and if she behaves nicely she can get nice advice on how to improve her casino, after all, there are many experienced people here.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: I'm very shocked by your casino, how is it possible that you create a casino that doesn't have a TOS and FAQ and then ask people to create an account at your casino first so they can see the TOS, this is a huge absurdity and at least I see that your casino only has English and Russian, I assume that you are a Russian citizen who created this casino, I don't know what your intention was when you created this casino, but in my opinion if you want this business to be a very serious business , then you will need to take it much more seriously and when I talk about taking it much more seriously I mean starting by making your website a better presentable website, putting up the TOS and the FAQYou will also create a better presentable ANN Thread so that with just one look at it, anyone can understand a lot. This is just advice, if you want to move forward with this form of presentation and your casino in this form, then I wish you good luck, I prefer to first read the tos and faq although I don't have the habit of reading everything that is in us casinos, I still prefer to read the most important parts before creating an account. The way your casino is, you can't see what kind of games it has. It will be difficult to attract many customers this way.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: A website with a .cc extension is hard to take seriously and you can't even see the who;e site without registering. lol It's a free website afaik. Expect this to be a scam.I doubt someone will register for it when there are hundreds to thousands of options around. If you want to play dice, every casino we have here in the forum has it also. And almost all coins and tokens today have a casino dedicated to the token itself.

I doubt many user will be interested to deposit here while there’s tons of games as options in different casino.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: AbuBhakar on December 18, 2023, 04:41:15 PMQuote from: cabron on December 18, 2023, 04:22:20 PMA website with a .cc extension is hard to take seriously and you can't even see the who;e site without registering. lol It's a free website afaik. Expect this to be a scam.I doubt someone will register for it when there are hundreds to thousands of options around. If you want to play dice, every casino we have here in the forum has it also. And almost all coins and tokens today have a casino dedicated to the token itself. Website extension doesn’t matter anymore since many scam casino is already using .com and other “premium” extension just to look like a legit casino while it just cost few dollars because the domain name is what matters anymore to determine premium of the website. I honestly will have to disagree with you here, there is actually a big difference in having to doubt or speculate whether a site is a scam or not due to their level of commitment both in monetary terms, in build and launching something that is really appealing to people, this can not be compared to the site that doesn't want to spend a dime of their own money in their bid or quest to scam unsuspecting victims. I personally sometimes don't feel too bad when I am scammed by a site that clearly spent alot of money to make their site appear so legitimate and trustworthy. But nothing angers me like falling victim of scam or a site that even a 5 years old child should know it's a scam site from the way it was poorly designed and most important parts of the sites being built by things that are completely free of charge. Quote But on this case, The website is clearly new and offer only dice game that is already widely offer by all casino. I doubt many user will be interested to deposit here while there’s tons of games as options in different casino.And here, you are wrong again, this site is not new as you claimed, the domain age according to scam adviser is 2 year old, a platform that have operated for 2 whole years can't be considered new I believe, you can verify this on https://www.scamadviser.com/check-website/dicex.ccFor a platform or domain to be considered new, it has to be in between the age of 1 to 100 days.

comments.author: shield132
comments.body: OP it's not good to force users to register on your website before they start using of it. I want to review your website at first but I can't because popup asks me to register or log-in. At the same moment, I also saw one screen from our member where it's stated on your website to avoid multiple accounts. If you want people to avoid multiple accounts, get that popup removed or many people will quickly register for the sake of viewing the functionality of the whole website and then they'll forget details of their account.Quote from: cabron on December 18, 2023, 04:22:20 PMA website with a .cc extension is hard to take seriously and you can't even see the who;e site without registering. lol It's a free website afaik. Expect this to be a scam.What's the problem with the .cc domain? Does it matter if website ends with .com, .io, .cc or other domain names?
